definition: can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very

pinyin: ji1 bu4 ke3 shi1 , shi1 bu4 zai4 lai2
ji1 bu4 ke3 shi1 , shi2 bu4 zai4 lai2

sentences.english: I felt now or never and went right up to him.
sentences.chinese: 我感觉到机不可失，所以径直走到他面前。

sentences.english: Take time when time comes lest time steal away.
It's now or never, shall we chance it?
sentences.chinese: 机不可失，时不再来。咱们要不要碰碰运气？

sentences.english: That is a good offer and we should take fortune at the tide.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个很好的机会，我们要机不可失。

pinyin: ji1 bu4 ke3 shi1 , shi2 bu4 zai4 lai2

definition: Time that has passed will never come back. (idiom)
extremely rare (idiom)/once in a blue moon
to observe and make sure/to check
strike first and gain the upper hand (idiom, martial arts term); Making the first move is an advantage.
win or lose, it all ends here/this is the moment to shine
pinyin: cheng2 bai4 zai4 ci3 yi1 ju3

definition: the matter should not be delayed/there's no time to lose
to sit and waste a good opportunity (idiom); to lose the chance
time and tide wait for no man (idiom)
to seize the opportunity/to strike while the iron is hot
to take advantage of a favorable situation/to seize an opportunity
